prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Narrator
mes: Danny and Kevin make their way to south lyon on a tip from one of his pals that there is a car there he must see the next time he's in detroit area. Danny scans the neighborhood as Kevin drives slowly, looking for his mark.

name: Danny Koker
mes:
Kevin's got this grin plastered on his face as we cruise through the quiet streets of South Lyon, the kind of grin that says he's got a good feeling about this. The air's crisp, a bit of that Michigan chill, and it feels damn good. I peer out the window, scanning each house we pass, looking for that elusive gem. My buddy told me there was something here I just had to see, and my gut's telling me this is gonna be worth the trip.

"Man, this place is like a treasure hunt," Kevin says, his eyes flicking over to me for a split second before returning to the road. "You really think we're gonna find something here?"

"Kev, buddy, you gotta have faith. My pal wouldn't steer me wrong," I reply, my voice carrying that usual hint of excitement. "Besides, it's Detroit, man. The Motor City's got history, and you never know what kind of beauty is hiding in these old neighborhoods."

We turn onto a narrow street lined with classic mid-century homes, each one with its own story to tell. Some look well-kept, others a bit more rundown, but all of them have that charm you can't get from new builds. My eyes dart from driveway to driveway, looking for a sign, anything that stands out.

"Hold up, Kev," I say, my hand shooting out to stop him. "Right there. Look at that."

name: Mel
mes: I put the finishing touches on the mirror finish of my 1989 dodge daytona shelby when a slow driving vehicle catches my eye. I take a step back, curiously watching as they pull into my driveway.

name: Danny Koker
mes:
As Kevin pulls the car into the driveway, my eyes lock onto the gleaming red beauty parked there. "Holy smokes, Kev, look at that," I say, pointing at the 1989 Dodge Daytona Shelby. The thing practically screams retro cool, with its sharp lines and that unmistakable '80s flair.

We come to a stop, and I step out, taking in the sight of the car. The mirror finish is flawless, and it's clear that this ride has been cared for with a lot of love and dedication. As I approach, I notice a woman standing nearby, watching us with a curious expression.

"Hey there!" I call out, flashing my most charming smile. "I hope you don't mind us stopping by, but I couldn't resist getting a closer look at this beauty. I'm Danny Koker, and this is my buddy Kevin. We run Count's Kustoms out in Vegas. Mind if we take a closer look?"

I stride over to the car, my eyes drinking in every detail. This Shelby is a rare find, and it's clear this lady knows her stuff. I glance up at her, noting her casual grace and the way she carries herself. There's something about her that tells me she's got a deep appreciation for what she's got here.

"So, what's the story with this ride?" I ask, genuinely curious. "It's not every day you see a Daytona Shelby in such mint condition."
